front.title: IANA Registry for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) "Priority" Header Field

abstract.t: This document defines a new IANA registry to keep track of the values defined for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) "Priority" header field. It updates RFC 3261.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines a new IANA registry to keep track of the values defined for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) "Priority" header field. This header field was defined in , section 20.26. It was clearly specified in a way that allows for the creation of new values beyond those originally specified; however, no registry has been established for it.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document adds a new registry, "Priority Header Field Values." Its format and initial values are as shown in the following table:
The policy for registration of values in this registry is "IETF Review," as that term is defined by .

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This document does not have any impact on the security of the SIP protocol. Its purpose is purely administrative in nature.
